title: 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I get a compiler crash when I use the latest rust - I built it from source. Things were fine until yesterday (commit - ad7daed26f86732f41f5f83cd673e2)

Today after pulling in till - c7dd3c4d69aee1c4ad8cc220c194b176bba2ab62 I get the compiler crash.
I am trying to build an x86_64 kernel - https://github.com/ckkashyap/unix

```
make SOURCE_ROOT=$PWD -C boot/x86_64
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/ckk/Documents/unix/boot/x86_64'
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/ckk/Documents/unix/boot/x86_64'
make SOURCE_ROOT=$PWD -C kernel
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/ckk/Documents/unix/kernel'
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/ckk/Documents/RUST/install/lib /home/ckk/Documents/RUST/install/bin/rustc  kernel.rs --target /home/ckk/Documents/unix/x86_64-unix-kernel.json -Z no-landing-pads  --extern core=libcore.rlib -L /home/ckk/Documents/RUST/install/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', /home/ckk/Documents/RUST/rust/src/libsyntax/ast.rs:1213
```
